00012 void Mesh::loadObj(std::string filename)
00013 {
00014     std::fstream instream;
00015     instream.open(filename.c_str());
00016     Error::debug("Mesh::Loading mesh from %s\n", filename.c_str());
00017     if (!instream.is_open())
00018     {
00019         Error::error("Mesh::Error opening file: filename = %s\n", filename.c_str());
00020         return;
00021     }
00022     while (!instream.eof())
00023     {
00024         std::string currentLine;
00025         getline(instream, currentLine);
00026         //Error::debug("Mesh::Currentline is %s\n", currentLine.c_str());
00027         if (currentLine != "")  //Make sure that there is a first character to avoid errors
00028         {
00029             int temp;   //Used for throwing away dumps in sscanf
00030             if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "v %f%*s", &temp) == 1) {   //This is a vertex
00031                 vertices.push_back(Point3(currentLine));
00032             } else if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "vt %f%*s", &temp) == 1) {   //This is a texture vertex
00033                 texturePts.push_back(Point2(currentLine));
00034             } else if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "vn %f%*s", &temp) == 1) {   //This is a normal
00035                 normals.push_back(Point3(currentLine));
00036             } else if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "f %*s") == 0) {  //This is a face
00037                 if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "f %i/%i/%i%*s", &temp, &temp, &temp) == 3) {   //Vertex, textures, and normals
00038                     //Error::debug("Mesh::Pushing back a face with vertex/texture/normal\n");
00039                     std::vector<int> faceVerts;  //
00040                     std::vector<int> faceTexts;
00041                     std::vector<int> faceNorms;
00042                     std::string facePiece = "";
00043                     std::stringstream curLineStream(currentLine);
00044                     getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' '); //Get the piece that is just 'f'
00045                     while(!curLineStream.eof())
00046                     {
00047                         getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' ');
00048                         int vertIndex, textIndex, normIndex;
00049                         if (sscanf(facePiece.c_str(), "%i/%i/%i", &vertIndex, &textIndex, &normIndex) != 3) {
00050                             Error::error("Mesh::Trying to create a face from unusual data: string = %s\n", facePiece.c_str());
00051                         } else {
00052                             vertIndex -= 1; //Subtract one, since .obj files begin indexing at 1 instead of 0
00053                             textIndex -= 1;
00054                             normIndex -= 1;
00055                             if (vertIndex < 0 || vertIndex >= vertices.size()) {
00056                                 Error::error("Mesh::Tried to use a vertex index that was out of range: index = %i\n", vertIndex);
00057                             } else {
00058                                 faceVerts.push_back(vertIndex);
00059                             }
00060                             if (textIndex < 0 || textIndex >= texturePts.size()) {
00061                                 Error::error("Mesh::Tried to use a texture index that was out of range: index = %i\n", textIndex);
00062                             } else {
00063                                 faceTexts.push_back(textIndex);
00064                             }
00065                             if (normIndex < 0 || normIndex >= normals.size()) {
00066                                 Error::error("Mesh::Tried to use a normal index that was out of range: index = %i\n", normIndex);
00067                             } else {
00068                                 faceNorms.push_back(normIndex);
00069                             }
00070                         }
00071                     }
00072                     addFaceVTN(faceVerts, faceTexts, faceNorms);
00073                 } else if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "f %i//%i%*s", &temp, &temp) == 2) { //Vertex, normals
00074                     //Error::debug("Mesh::Pushing back a face with just a vertex//normal\n");
00075                     std::vector<int> faceVerts;  //
00076                     std::vector<int> faceNorms;
00077                     std::string facePiece = "";
00078                     std::stringstream curLineStream(currentLine);
00079                     getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' '); //Get the piece that is just 'f'
00080                     while(!curLineStream.eof())
00081                     {
00082                         getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' ');
00083                         int vertIndex, normIndex;
00084                         if (sscanf(facePiece.c_str(), "%i//%i", &vertIndex, &normIndex) != 2) {
00085                             Error::error("Mesh::Trying to create a face from unusual data: string = %s\n", facePiece.c_str());
00086                         } else {
00087                             vertIndex -= 1; //Subtract one, since .obj files begin indexing at 1 instead of 0
00088                             normIndex -= 1;
00089                             if (vertIndex < 0 || vertIndex >= vertices.size()) {
00090                                 Error::error("Mesh::Tried to use a vertex index that was out of range: index = %i\n", vertIndex);
00091                             } else {
00092                                 faceVerts.push_back(vertIndex);
00093                             }
00094                             if (normIndex < 0 || normIndex >= normals.size()) {
00095                                 Error::error("Mesh::Tried to use a normal index that was out of range: index = %i\n", normIndex);
00096                             } else {
00097                                 faceNorms.push_back(normIndex);
00098                             }
00099                         }
00100                     }
00101                     addFaceVN(faceVerts, faceNorms);
00102                 } else if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "f %i/%i%*s", &temp, &temp) == 2) {  //Vertex, textures
00103                     //Error::debug("Mesh::Pushing back a face with just a vertex/texture\n");
00104                     std::vector<int> faceVerts;  //
00105                     std::vector<int> faceTexts;
00106                     std::string facePiece = "";
00107                     std::stringstream curLineStream(currentLine);
00108                     getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' '); //Get the piece that is just 'f'
00109                     while(!curLineStream.eof())
00110                     {
00111                         getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' ');
00112                         int vertIndex, textIndex;
00113                         if (sscanf(facePiece.c_str(), "%i/%i", &vertIndex, &textIndex) != 2) {
00114                             Error::error("Mesh::Trying to create a face from unusual data: string = %s\n", facePiece.c_str());
00115                         } else {
00116                             vertIndex -= 1; //Subtract one, since .obj files begin indexing at 1 instead of 0
00117                             textIndex -= 1;
00118                             if (vertIndex < 0 || vertIndex >= vertices.size()) {
00119                                 Error::error("Mesh::Tried to use a vertex index that was out of range: index = %i\n", vertIndex);
00120                             } else {
00121                                 faceVerts.push_back(vertIndex);
00122                             }
00123                             if (textIndex < 0 || textIndex >= texturePts.size()) {
00124                                 Error::error("Mesh::Tried to use a texture index that was out of range: index = %i\n", textIndex);
00125                             } else {
00126                                 faceTexts.push_back(textIndex);
00127                             }
00128                         }
00129                     }
00130                     addFaceVT(faceVerts, faceTexts);
00131                 } else if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "f %i%*s", &temp) == 1) { //Just vertex
00132                     //Error::debug("Mesh::Pushing back a face with just a vertex\n");
00133                     std::vector<int> faceVerts;
00134                     std::string facePiece = "";
00135                     std::stringstream curLineStream(currentLine);
00136                     getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' '); //Get the piece that is just 'f'
00137                     while(!curLineStream.eof())
00138                     {
00139                         getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' ');
00140                         int vertIndex;
00141                         if (sscanf(facePiece.c_str(), "%i%*s", &vertIndex) == 1) {    //If it finds it
00142                             vertIndex -= 1;     //For whatever reason, in .obj files, each list starts with index 1
00143                             if (vertIndex >= 0 && vertIndex < vertices.size()) {      //If the index is in a valid range
00144                                 faceVerts.push_back(vertIndex);
00145                             } else {
00146                                 Error::error("Mesh::Tried to use a vertex index that was out of range: index = %i\n", vertIndex);
00147                             }
00148                         } else {
00149                             Error::error("Mesh::Trying to create a face from unusual data: string = %s\n", facePiece.c_str());
00150                         }
00151                     }
00152                     addFaceV(faceVerts);
00153                 }
00154             } else {
00155                 //Error::debug("Mesh::Got something in the Obj file that wasn't what I expected: %s\n", currentLine.c_str());
00156             }
00157         }
00158     }
00159 
00160     /* For printing out a mesh after loading * /
00161     printf("Loaded a mesh, vertices are:\n");
00162     for (int i = 0; i < vertices.size(); i++) {
00163         printf("   %i: <%f, %f, %f>\n", i, vertices[i].x, vertices[i].y, vertices[i].z);
00164     }
00165     printf("Loaded a mesh, textures are:\n");
00166     for (int i = 0; i < textures.size(); i++) {
00167         printf("   %i: <%f, %f, %f>\n", i, textures[i].x, textures[i].y, textures[i].z);
00168     }
00169     printf("Loaded a mesh, normals are:\n");
00170     for (int i = 0; i < normals.size(); i++) {
00171         printf("   %i: <%f, %f, %f>\n", i, normals[i].x, normals[i].y, normals[i].z);
00172     }
00173     /**/
00174 
00175     instream.close();
00176 }

00178 void Mesh::loadTexture(std::string filename) {
00179     textureId = TextureManager::getInstance()->loadBMP(filename);
00180 }
00181 
00182 void Mesh::addFaceVTN(std::vector<int>& vertIndexes, std::vector<int>& textIndexes, std::vector<int>& normalIndexes) {
00183     Face newFace;
00184     newFace.registerVertices(&(this->vertices));
00185     newFace.registerVertexIndexes(vertIndexes);
00186     newFace.registerTextures(&(this->texturePts));
00187     newFace.registerTextureIndexes(textIndexes);
00188     newFace.registerNormals(&(this->normals));
00189     newFace.registerNormalIndexes(normalIndexes);
00190     if (vertIndexes.size() != textIndexes.size() || vertIndexes.size() != normalIndexes.size() || textIndexes.size() != normalIndexes.size()) {
00191         Error::error("Mesh::addFaceVTN() There are %i vertices, %i texturePts, and %i normals\n", vertIndexes.size(), textIndexes.size(), normalIndexes.size());
00192     }
00193     faces.push_back(newFace);
00194 }
00195

00199     newFace.registerVertexIndexes(vertIndexes);
00200     newFace.registerNormals(&(this->normals));
00201     newFace.registerNormalIndexes(normalIndexes);
00202     faces.push_back(newFace);
00203     /*
00204     printf("Created a face: ");
00205     for (int i = 0; i < vertIndexes.size(); i++) {
00206         printf("%i/%i ", vertIndexes[i], normalIndexes[i]);
00207     }
00208     printf("\n");
00209     */
00210 }

00212 void Mesh::addFaceVT(std::vector<int>& vertIndexes, std::vector<int>& textIndexes) {
00213     Face newFace;
00214     newFace.registerVertices(&(this->vertices));
00215     newFace.registerVertexIndexes(vertIndexes);
00216     newFace.registerTextures(&(this->texturePts));
00217     newFace.registerTextureIndexes(textIndexes);
00218 
00219     //Register the normals anyway, even though they aren't being used
00220     newFace.registerNormals(&(this->normals));
00221     faces.push_back(newFace);
00222 }
00223 
00224 void Mesh::addFaceV(std::vector<int>& vertIndexes) {
00225     Face newFace;
00226     newFace.registerVertices(&(this->vertices));
00227     newFace.registerVertexIndexes(vertIndexes);
00228 
00229     //Register the normals anyway, even though they aren't being used
00230     newFace.registerNormals(&(this->normals));
00231     faces.push_back(newFace);
00232 }

00234 void Mesh::addFaceAndReverseVTN(std::vector<int>& vertIndexes, std::vector<int>& textIndexes, std::vector<int>& normalIndexes) {
00235     addFaceVTN(vertIndexes, textIndexes, normalIndexes);
00236     std::vector<int> newVerts;
00237     std::vector<int> newTexts;
00238     std::vector<int> newNorms;
00239     newVerts.resize(vertIndexes.size());
00240     newTexts.resize(textIndexes.size());
00241     newNorms.resize(normalIndexes.size());
00242     for (int i = 0; i < vertIndexes.size(); i++) {
00243         newVerts[i] = vertIndexes[vertIndexes.size() - i - 1];
00244     }
00245     for (int i = 0; i < textIndexes.size(); i++) {
00246         newTexts[i] = textIndexes[textIndexes.size() - i - 1];
00247     }
00248     for (int i = 0; i < normalIndexes.size(); i++) {
00249         newNorms[i] = normalIndexes[normalIndexes.size() - i - 1];
00250     }
00251     addFaceVTN(newVerts, newTexts, newNorms);
00252 }

00254 //Adds two faces, facing in both directions, so that one can be sure that neither side is see through
00255 void Mesh::addFaceAndReverseVN(std::vector<int>& vertIndexes, std::vector<int>& normalIndexes) {
00256     addFaceVN(vertIndexes, normalIndexes);
00257     std::vector<int> newVerts;
00258     std::vector<int> newNorms;
00259     newVerts.resize(vertIndexes.size());
00260     newNorms.resize(normalIndexes.size());
00261     for (int i = 0; i < vertIndexes.size(); i++) {
00262         newVerts[i] = vertIndexes[vertIndexes.size() - i - 1];
00263     }
00264     for (int i = 0; i < normalIndexes.size(); i++) {
00265         newNorms[i] = normalIndexes[normalIndexes.size() - i - 1];
00266     }
00267     addFaceVN(newVerts, newNorms);
00268 }

00286 void Mesh::addFaceAndReverseV(std::vector<int>& vertIndexes)
00287 {
00288     addFaceV(vertIndexes);
00289     std::vector<int> newVerts;
00290     newVerts.resize(vertIndexes.size());
00291     for (int i = 0; i < vertIndexes.size(); i++)
00292     {
00293         newVerts[i] = vertIndexes[vertIndexes.size() - i - 1];
00294     }
00295     addFaceV(newVerts);
00296 }
00297 
00302 void Mesh::calculateNormals() {
00303     //First, clear normal data
00304     normals.resize(vertices.size());
00305     for (int i = 0; i < normals.size(); i++) {
00306         normals[i] = Point3(0,0,0);
00307     }
00308 
00309     //This will add every face's normal to all of the vertices of that face
00310     //then reassign each normal index to the corresponding vertex index
00311     for (int i = 0; i < faces.size(); i++) {
00312         faces[i].addOwnNormals();
00313     }
00314 
00315     //This will normalize all normals, so that they are unit
00316     for (int i = 0; i < normals.size(); i++) {
00317         normals[i] = normals[i].getUnit();
00318     }
00319 }
00320 
00321 bool Mesh::drawMesh() {
00322     glBindTexture(GL_TEXTURE_2D, textureId);
00323     for (int i = 0; i < faces.size(); i++) {
00324         if (!faces[i].drawFace()) {
00325             return false;
00326         }
00327     }
00328     return true;
00329 }
